Key Match Events: A dropped pop-up by Brayan Rocchio in the first inning led to an unearned run.
Two singles and a double to lead off the second inning led to another run.

Cade Smith has been nearly untouchable this postseason. In eight innings, he’s been charged with one run and has given up just two hits -- none of which came against the Yankees in 1 2/3 frames on Tuesday.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Stephen Vogt didn’t want to take any chances with the rotation’s performance, opting to turn to Cade Smith with the bases loaded.
Post-Match Reflections: Tanner Bibee expressed frustration with his performance, wanting the chance to get out of the situation he worked himself into.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians fell, 6-3, to the Yankees in Game 2 of the American League Championship Series to go down 2-0 in the series.
In all best-of-seven postseason series, teams taking a 2-0 lead have gone on to win the series 76 of 91 times (84%).
Others: Manager Stephen Vogt said the rotation has turned in four straight starts of fewer than three innings, and they’ll need more innings out of their starter so that the bullpen can handle a heavy workload for three straight games without a day off.
The Guardians don’t have a crystal ball, so they don’t know how this will play out, but they can be certain of needing their starters to handle a few more innings to keep this bullpen sharp.
